subject: Wildlings
event: The wildlings have arrived, and just in time for Yule. Dark Sword Miniatures has rolled out three new miniatures, wildling captains set to lead your raiding parties. All of these are available at the Dark Sword Online store. Here's the "green" for Rattleshirt, aka the Lord o' Bones: Here's a nicely painted version of Alfyn Crowkiller. Alas, poor Alfyn, he was killed off-stage before he could actually appear in the books, but while he was alive he kicked ass. And last, but definitely NOT least, a gorgeous version of Mance Rayder, sometime bard, and King Beyond the Wall. Dark Sword has some other nice figures on offer as well, including a lovely Tom Meier "sorceress" who could easily be added to your Westerosi miniature court, and a new Jeff Grace female archer from the Elmore range who might work as well, with more clothes. Check them all out at http://darkswordminiatures.com/ Oh, and speaking of Tom Meier... I've gotten a few emails wondering when we'll be adding some direwolves to the Dark Sword range. That's in the works, I promise it is... but if you'd rather not wait, and really want a Ghost to put beside your own Jon Snow, well, Tom Meier has recently issued two terrific new wolves as part of his own Thunderbolt Mountain range. Tom was kind enough to send me some of each, and I can promise, these are very cool sculpts, and ought to make great direwolves. I'm having some painted up for my own collection right now. They're available from Thunderbolt Mountain at http://www.thunderboltmountain.com/ Comments on the miniatures are welcome here. Comments on other stuff, not so much.

comments.article:
Those look absolutely AMAZING

mayhaps there will some day be a short story, telling us who Alfyn Crowkiller was... (wink, wink, nudge, nudge)

comments.article:
I've often wondered if Westeros's direwolves (and aurochs for that matter) are the same as their real-world counterparts. I'll be VERY interested to see the dedicated direwolves.

What can I say? I guess I just demand historical accuracy to my fantasy. :/

comments.upictitle: The Bacterium Formerly Known As Ashley: raposa
comments.article:
Actual dire wolves were about the same size as real wolves. And if memory serves (I don't have the books on me atm), the dire wolves in ASoIF are described as much, much larger than regular wolves. So no, they wouldn't be the same. :)
(/end biogeek)
How could you kill Alfyn Crowkiller?  And not even make us love him first?

Oh man Lord o' Bones looks freaking awesome!

And Mance, wow, that's even better than I imagined
Man, a Song of Ice and Fire role playing game would kick ass.

It's currently out of print but there was one a few years agao

http://www.amazon.com/Game-Thrones-D20-Based-Open-Gaming/dp/1588469425
I want a puppy!!!!!

No positive thoughts, lest you die of a rare blood disease or something?
Best wishes anyway!
comments.subject: We can't wish you good health?

comments.article: These are awesome.  Mance in particular looks incredible.  Here's to stimulating the economy.
comments.subject: Awesome!

comments.article:
Of the three new ones, it looks like only Alfyn Crowkiller is available for sale at the moment. The other two (Mance and Rattleshirt) are pictured as previews, unless I'm not looking in the right place.

(and best of holiday wishes to you, George)
comments.subject: just the one so far...

comments.article:
Ooops. Right you are. I guess I got a little too excited.

They'll be available soon, though.
comments.subject: Re: just the one so far...

comments.article:
I can't wait to see the official direwolves. I know they are in the works, but I want to assure you there is continued interest.

And I second the vote for the story of Alfyn Crowkiller. I love getting more from the Song of Ice and Fire world and the wonderful characters you've created...even the ones we haven't met, yet.

Mance Rayder must be one of my favorite characters, by far the best King of the bunch, and that speech you wrote for him about his cloak was superb. I hope his life is to be long and blessed, though I have my fears on that score.
Though he may be more expensive to produce because of his huge member.
comments.subject: I vote for Tormund Giantsbabe next

comments.article:
As already mentioned, the RPG from Green Ronin should be out in the near future.

Is there any discussion for a miniatures game to go along with these lovely figures?

-Ed
comments.subject: A miniatures game in the works?

comments.article:
I'm excited, these look so awesome! I only wish I had the patience to paint them to look nice...

...patience as epic as this guy:
A nice set of pics! Thanks for keeping us abreast of such releases. Can never have too many wolvers about, even if just in miniature!
comments.subject: Looks good!

comments.article:
Mr. Martin,

Sorry this message isn't about the miniatures, even though they are super cool. I wish I had a big house with a room set aside for stuff like that. Alas, I do not.

To the point now. I just read A Song for Lya for the first time. I have read nearly all of your major works and a large number of your short stories. This one is by far, one of your master works! I related to parts of the story more than you can imagine. Thank you Sir, for your work is truly remarkable. I just wish there were Greeshka here on Earth for lonely people like me to go to Union.

Love,
Jason
comments.subject: A Song for Lya

comments.article:
First time I have delved into this locale, and it has been interesting. I have been haunting the GRRM site for months desperately searching for news on the latest in the Ice and Fire series, but just scanning the news, and checking to see if there was another chapter to calm the withdrawals.
The most intriguing thing I would not have expected was to find George is a football fan. From all I have read from and on this wonderfully refreshing author, I expected a Tolkien-like scholar, eschewing the more banal aspects of Americana. Don't get me wrong, I am a lifelong Cowboy and Longhorn fan having grown up in Texas, and a Tolkien, Howard, etc. fan from an early age, so I guess I shouldn't be surprised. All I can add is, I will check this area regularly to see what else I can learn about my new favorite writer and his fans.
Anxiously awaiting A Dance With Dragons in North Carolina.
comments.subject: Not a blog

comments.article: Three blasts.
Miniatures? You call those "miniatures"? Nah, they're small, but they're not miniature...THIS is "miniature": http://www.guzer.com/videos/needle-art.php

Dear George Martin, you probably won't have time to read/answer this, but What color are Mance's eyes?
In GOT you say he has "shrewd brown eyes".
In ADWD Melisandre notices his eyes changing: "Grey eyes, brown eyes. Melisandre could see the color change with each pulse of the ruby."
But also in ADWD you say Rattleshirt has "little yellow eyes", just before his fight with Jon. So, under the glamour, shouldn't his eyes change from yellow to brown?
I wonder if Mance's eyes are really brown or are they grey???
I guess the odds of getting this question answered will be like winning the lottery, but trying doesn't hurt...
:)
comments.subject: Mance's eyes
